items.title: All the Stocks Warren Buffett Bought in the Last 2 Recessions: Are They Smart Picks Now?
items.author: The Motley Fool
items.description: Warren Buffett, the legendary investor, has built a substantial cash stockpile for Berkshire Hathaway, preparing to be 'greedy when others are fearful' during a potential recession. The article examines the stocks Buffett bought during the Great Recession and the COVID-19 pandemic, and analyzes which of them could be smart picks now.

insights.sentiment_reasoning: Kroger is seen as a good defensive stock to own during market volatility, as cost-conscious consumers may opt for private-label foods over Kraft Heinz's brands if the economy worsens.
Kraft Heinz is also considered a defensive stock, but Kroger is viewed as the better pick of the two.
Healthcare stocks like Elevance Health, Johnson & Johnson, and Sanofi are expected to hold up well during market turbulence, and have delivered gains even as the stock market has plunged this year.
Healthcare stocks like Elevance Health, Johnson & Johnson, and Sanofi are expected to hold up well during market turbulence, and have delivered gains even as the stock market has plunged this year.
Healthcare stocks like Elevance Health, Johnson & Johnson, and Sanofi are expected to hold up well during market turbulence, and have delivered gains even as the stock market has plunged this year.
UnitedHealth Group has also performed well year to date and could remain a good stock to own during overall market turbulence.

Barrick Gold, a leading gold and copper mining company, has benefited as investors flocked to gold in recent months, and the stock remains attractively valued with a forward earnings multiple below 12, making it the best of the previous Buffett recession buys, at least over the near term.
